meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a baritone voice.
meanings.sent1: Her baritonal voice added depth to the choir's performance.
meanings.sent2: The singer's baritonal tones resonated throughout the auditorium.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at a baritonal falsetto made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The baritonal quality of the cello's sound enveloped the audience.
meanings.sent5: The baritonal notes lingered in the air long after the song ended.

meanings.definition: Having a low pitch or range, similar to that of a baritone voice.
meanings.sent1: The baritonal hum of the bass guitar set the rhythm for the band.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with the baritonal sound of the grandfather clock.
meanings.sent3: The baritonal growl of the engine signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent4: His laughter had a baritonal quality that echoed in the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The baritonal rumble of thunder warned of the approaching storm.
